trigger_event: As the citywide committee inspects the fractured BCI system, evidence emerges that different zones are already enforcing wildly different sets of rules, leading to confusion, frustration, and a surge of desperate messages from neighborhoods fearful that chaos or abuse will follow.
dilemma: Nikola faces a stark choice: Should he urge the committee to force a single citywide BCI standard—risking stifling local experiments but preserving stability—or unlock Halden’s spiral override for all free zones, embracing local justice even if it breeds unpredictable new divisions?
reason: Nikola is torn between his lifelong suspicion of centralized power and the real fear of unleashing rival factions on ordinary citizens. His recent late-night conversations with Alex, the bartender, echo in his mind—urging him to weigh human needs over rigid order. Nikola knows his signature alone can tip the balance, with no clear path back once chosen.
choice_a: Oppose the spiral override, insisting on a unified citywide BCI framework to prevent fragmentation and new abuses.
belief_a: Only universal rules shield citizens from petty local tyrannies.
Even flawed unity is less dangerous than chaos.
Order gives communities time to heal and rebuild.
choice_b: Authorize the spiral override across free zones, letting each community set its own rules—even if it sparks local conflict and unpredictable justice.
belief_b: Communities must decide what justice looks like for themselves.
Unlocking power to the people is worth the risks.
Local agency heals wounds that central control cannot touch.
